moth_beans_details.description: Moth beans, also known as matki or Turkish gram, are small, drought-resistant legumes commonly grown in arid and semi-arid regions. They are cultivated for their edible seeds, which are rich in protein and other nutrients.
moth_beans_details.nutritional value: Moth beans are a good source of protein, dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals. They are low in fat and high in complex carbohydrates, making them a nutritious addition to the diet.
moth_beans_details.uses: Cooking (curries, stews, soups), Sprouting, Flour production
moth_beans_details.varieties: Regular moth beans, Sprouting moth beans

prerequisites.soil: Moth beans prefer well-drained sandy loam soil with good fertility.
prerequisites.climate: Moth beans thrive in hot and dry climates, with temperatures ranging from 70°F to 95°F (21°C to 35°C) during the growing season.
prerequisites.water: Moth beans are drought-tolerant but require occasional watering, especially during flowering and pod formation.
prerequisites.frost: Moth beans are sensitive to frost and should be planted after the last frost date.
prerequisites.space: Plant moth bean seeds about 1 to 2 inches deep and 4 to 6 inches apart in rows spaced 12 to 18 inches apart.
